title: Excellent GP surgery
body: I changed GP surgery about 3 years ago due to moving to the area, I was a little dubious about having a new doctor for my family & I as I was used to my previous one. I can honestly say I'm  so impressed with Riverside medical centre, When I phone for an appointment I or my family are seen the same day when its urgent, I have never struggled to get an appointment & when I am seen the doctors are on time too, no long waiting times like I've previously experienced. Each doctor I have seen are extremely professional & do everything in their power to diagnose the problem. I cannot fault the surgery at all. The receptionists are polite & friendly, not intrusive or rude which I've previously experienced in previous surgeries. The dispensary staff cannot do enough for you,  they are so kind & friendly & remember your name too! I recently requested a repeat prescription online on the same morning as I saw the doctor & when I went to the dispensary it was ready & waiting! They knew when I was due to run out of my tablets & repeated the prescription automatically, I was so impressed at their excellent patient service throughout & I would highly recommend Riverside medical centre.

title: Need to change the culture and put patients at…
body:
Patient experience doesn’t appear to be high on the priority list at this practice.
There is a lack of insight into what it feels like to be a patient on the receiving end of care, from the minute you step into the building. The clinical care is usually good when you get in front of a professional, but the booking process, communication and experience could be better.
Hard working staff can be cold, defensive, unfriendly and at times rude; my good morning greeting after  digital checkin was met with an uncomfortable stare and silence by staff at the front desk. High quality patient care doesn’t just mean good outcomes, it has to be safe and the experience matters too. On my recent visit I waited 45 mins over my appointment time. There was no acknowledgement or apology, no communication to inform me the Dr was running late, indignation and a lack of eye contact when I dared to approach the desk to ask when I might be seen. 
Clearly the service is under huge pressure as demand continually increases, but losing sight of the patient/customer experience undermines quality. This practice is a merger melting pot, but the culture that needs to evolve is one of compassion, caring and kindness. Leaders set the tone and it is down to the leadership to help create the climate to allow the practice  and it’s team to flourish. This is a fantastic facility but it could be so much better - listen and learn from the reviews, they speak for themselves. Reviewer anonymity isn’t a reason to do nothing. Managers need to take a good look at the organisation and make a concerted effort to make a change. It’s really that simple.

title: Great Practice
body: Very happy with this practice - always helpful.  I would and already have recommended to others.  Thank you.

title: Rescheduling Appointments
body: My teenage daughter has severe eczema.  She was referred by the GP in Feb 2019.... An appointment was given for July 2019, this was then cancelled and rescheduled for September 19.  The September 19 appointment was then cancelled and rescheduled for October 19.  The October 19 was cancelled and rescheduled for March 20...surely !!!.  All these cancellations by the hospital, while my daughters eczema is getting to the worst it has ever been.  We then received a letter asking if we still needed the appointment....which was rescheduled to 11th February 20.  With less than 2 weeks to the appointment date, the appointment was cancelled and rescheduled to the Brentwood Community Hospital for the 8th February 20, which was good.  Only that they can only provide temporary measures (steroid tablets), even though my daughter said to the consultant that she gets rebound effects from using this medication each time it has been prescribed, so she was not keen on taking them.  Now we have to wait even longer to get an appointment with Basildon hospital...as the community hospital can only do so much, she needs care from the hospital.  This condition is depressing my daughter.  Her school performance has drastically gone downhill, because she can't stand going to school with her skin like that.   Such a poor appointment system.

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: friendly people
body: I was seen on time and the people were friendly and informative. If I need to go again, I know that I will be looked after and can ask any questions without feeling silly.

title: Delivery suite staff
body:
Gave birth to my 2nd daughter here and both time I cannot fault the midwives on delivery suite! The care and attention I received was second to none! The midwives were both amazing and never left my side throughout the whole labour. 

Thank you so much!

title: Great department.
body: I have been attending this department for about a year. The care and practical information as been excellent. I was put at ease from my first appointment to my last. It’s a shame all nhs departments are not run as well as this. My physiotherapist was exceptional and the staff in the department were so friendly. When I first visited I thought I was going to have an operation but she gave me exercises and I never thought I would feel  able to manage my problem but I can now. Thankyou again pilgrim hospital.

title: Fantastic service
body: I came in a very nervous patient and left a much happier and relaxed person thanks to the soothing manor of the Doctor.I can not recommend the practice highly enough.

title: Clean Morden building
body: Was told straight away that clinic was running behind schedule due to I/t problems but was seen with in the hour of waiting was explained procedure and the staff were pleasant and very sorry for making us wait .

title: Avoid: Worst experience with mismanaged surgery…
body:
I visited the hospital in Dec 2019 and was referred for surgery. At the appointment, I was told that the hospital will contact me to arrange the appointment soon. 
No one contacted me for weeks, then I received an appointment for an after surgery follow up in March even though no surgery was yet scheduled. After struggling to contact the Gynecology reception for a few days finally I managed to speak with the receptionist and explained that I had a follow-up appointment for a surgery which was not scheduled and asked him to check what had gone wrong. He was extremely rude and refused to help at all saying that this was not his job even though in the letter which I received from the hospital I was instructed to contact the reception on exactly that phone number if I have any issues with the surgery appointment. I then went to my GP and asked them to contact the hospital which they did but it has been almost a month since then and still no surgery appointment. Today I tried to contact the reception again but this time the receptionist just said to hold on a minute, I waited for 20 min on the phone and he did not respond. Then I tried to contact the reception again a few times through the day and every time my call was redirected to voice mail.  A similar thing happened to me in the same department in November: I was unable to contact reception for days until I finally went to the hospital only to find out that the receptionist was keeping the phone open so that they can play on their phone and chat with their colleagues. 
I do not know who to contact to get this problem resolved.  I tried to email the hospital but no one responded. 
I will never ever use this hospital again!

title: GAU Team "You ticked all the 6 Cs"
body:
A big thank you
On the 23.02.2020 late shift and night. 
I came in with severe pain being escorted escorted by a total stranger. To that stranger thank you.
To the team: You were empathetic, you respected me, involved me in the care you were providing despite the fact that at the time I was not even paying attention.  But you created the time to come back to me to ensure that I am part of the care you are providing.
you were caring, quick to respond and to act.
Please keep-up the good JOB.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Theater and Recovery team"All the 6 Cs were…
body:
A big thank you.
on 23/24.02.2020, without warning I find myself in your unit
You treated me with dignity and respect.
Recovery team I noted that you were checking on throughout the night to ensure that I am alright.
You maintained good communication, you were very empathetic and caring.
A big thank you.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Great staff nurses
body: Went to Minor injuries with an infected finger from a splinter. Every time they we so very professional and caring. Can’t say enough good things about them. They are a credit to the NHS. Superb!

title: Very good practice
body: We moved to Hampton in October and we have found this practice to be very good. I don't know why the receptionists get complaints. We have always found them very helpful and very pleasant and cheerful. Apart from once we have found the doctor's are very good and we've been very happy with the way we have been treated and have been referred for treatment at the hospital very quickly. Thank you to everyone at the Hampton Vale Surgery.

title: Very good and kind friendly walk in centres
body:
Came to use the Shakespeare's walk in centre at the Sunday with there was a short waiting ( one hour) and then I was seen by a kind doctor. Really helpful, with a further examination left really happy with advice and a prescription.
Receptionists are at the best I’ve experiences from the nhs very friendly and polite, to me and me children. Making the families feel very comfortable and welcome even told me where is best to collect my medicines thank-you walk in centre!!

title: Ticketing system at A&E public walk-in entrance
body: I have had occasion, unfortunately, to visit A&E at QA a few times. When you are waiting to see the triage nurse there doesn't seem to be a system so that people are assessed in turn. Why is there not a numbered ticketing system in place as there is in, for example, blood tests department.  There must be occasions where an argument results as to who was next to be seen.

title: Great practice
body: On my consultation with G.P at Mirfield Surgery. I found friendly and efficient staff. Doctor talked me through entire range of my health issues. He explained causes and treatment and possibilities for the future. He gave me a range of tests and examinations and arranged for future tests.After several years of stress and worry. I felt at last that everything Possible was being done for my health and well-being For the professional concern and interest shown to me thank you very much

title: Calm, friendly and efficient
body: Admitted via ambulance, triaged almost immediately to ascertain whether or not it was an emergency. Everyone I came in to contact with was friendly, calm and efficient. The care I received was methodical and thorough. Quite a wait to go AAU, then an overnight wait to transfer to a ward but to be honest the AAU trolleys are as comfortable as a hospital bed and all the other amenities are much the same. Everyone worked so hard, it was really annoying to hear people complaining. If they were well enough to complain, did they really need to be going to A&E?  Thank you WSH!!

title: Ambulatory Care (Gate  A1)
body:
I was sent to Gate A1 by my GP who was querying a DVT. Arrived onto the unit, gave my name and they were expecting me, sat in waiting area for around 30 minutes, watched Phillip & Holly make a chicken curry on This Morning on the TV and was then called in for triage. Bloods taken & obs done, ultrasound booked. Left unit to go get some lunch and given a pager. Whilst eating the lunch upstairs in the canteen the pager sounded, back to A1 where porters were waiting. Taken to Radiology, Ultrasound done straight away - advised no blood clot. Back to A1, another short wait (less than 20 mins) to watch a bit of Judge Rinder then Consultant called me in. 
No DVT, diagnosed as a complication of a pre-existing problem. Although the issue cannot have been resolved today by Ambulatory Care/A&E the care and attention I was provided with was excellent. I was given a prescription for some different medications, advice, reassurance and sent on my way. 

Consultant also gave me a letter to help fast track some appointments already had in the pipeline. Got home called secretarial team and appointment made for next week. 

Very impressed with the care and “service” I received today. I couldn’t have asked for better treatment. Every member of staff I saw was thorough, very friendly and caring. I have a complex medical history and a bit of a journey ahead (slight understatement) and my coping mechanism is to joke and act about, the staff recognised this and obliged in joining me in my humour. They were patient, understanding of my concerns and appeared to genuinely care, if today was anything to go by then I’m in good hands for my future journey. 

The NHS takes a lot of criticism regularly, it’s only right that when things go well that we take the time to feed that back. 

Well done everyone and thank you.

title: Superb staff!
body:
After a fall I needed to attend A&E for an injury (as it ended up needing more than 'Elastoplast'). Unfortunately, there was some wait due to it being very busy. However, during the whole process the staff were lovely; by that I mean very professional, friendly, kind. Despite the fact there must have been a degree of stress.
So apart from the wait... 5 star staff!

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: patient confidentiality - passwords
body:
Regarding telephone enquiries in respect of a patient.  Just to advise that it can be necessary to apply to register for a password.  Perhaps Royal Lancaster Infirmary can clarify the process.  The reasons of confidentiality etc are of course understood.
To add that people are naturally worried when enquiring about their ill loved ones and the manner in which they are spoken to is all important.  

I thank certain kind staff members who employ high standards of care.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

title: Endoscopy Unit
body: Efficient, punctual, caring, clear in use of language. Not a pleasant procedure but made as easy as possible by great staff. A credit to our great NHS.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: 111 is incredibly slow service
body: Rang originally at 2:40pm. Now 10pm, second call back to say sorry for the delay. As mentioned in original call, overtired due to lack of sleep due to itching of spots (came up overnight). Rang 111 as worried about risk to other people. Spots have since increased. Each call 111 asked me: Do you feel worse or have your symptoms got worse? The honest answer is no. However, I'm covered in more spots than before and doesn't alleviate my worries regarding my condition. Which is obviously a fustration. The challenge is in feeling worse vs. having worse symptoms. I'm very tired as I didn't sleep well last night due to the original complaint i.e lots of red spots which woke up me up due to the itching. The difficulty is when you're balancing working because you need to (self employed) vs. worried about other peoples health. 111 has probed to be no use to be. I can appreciate the delays myself and many others are experiencing due to the present pressures to the service (i.e coronavirus). I would suggest more funding to resource the needs to those wishing to engage with the service. This would save the NHS time and money, as would reduce the attendance at A and E and GP practice. If this service is expected to be of benefit, it must have enough resources to respond to those who are reaching out for help, and if isn't to fulfil this criteria, and in turn give useful advice, must ask itself, what function does this serve. My experience could be an isolated indecent. However, I would implore a review in the service. My experience would show a common mentality amongst those whom are self employed. Without the benefits of sick pay, you have little to no choice but to work. I have the utmost respect for the NHs service, so do not look to criticise. Just wish to improve the system, as the 111 service is unable to meet the needs of those wishing to access it. Those of genuine health concerns, following an experience of mine, would not be willing to use this service again.

title: Grateful patient
body:
I was admitted on 19/2/2020 with my fourth heart attack, The team were very professional and worked in a confidence inspiring way, Each one making sure I felt in great hands all the way they put right my problems, The consultant though being brought in as he was going to bed was very pleasant and even found the time for a little chat as they prepared me for the ward.
The fantastic care was continued in the Coronary care unit through to my discharge home, A highly skilled and caring set of staff from start to finish, Although nobody wants to be in this situation, I couldn't have possibly asked for better treatment, Well done and a massive thank you to all involved from me and my family.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Nice environment!
body: My appointment was on time. All staff was cooperative and helpful. It was first experience for that scan but they explained the procedure nicely and made me feel comfortable.

author: romeoxt95
title: Treatment by all concerned was exemplary
body:
Went to see doctor at my medical practice at the beginning of August as I had passed a lot of blood and had experienced irregular bowel movements he referred me for a colonoscopy/MRI and CT scan which were done within 2 weeks.  
Was diagnosed with bowel cancer met surgeon and cancer nurse and then consultant oncologist from western general to shrink cancerous tumour.  
Arranged for me to have radiotherapy/chemotherapy started that mid Sept then finished mid October check up in late November and arranged for surgery in January to remove tumour.  
Had surgery at Victoria Hospital Kirkcaldy in January and was fitted with Stoma.  
Treatment by all concerned was exemplary, staff are friendly  
very efficient and compassionate but they are overworked  
Food in hospital was excellent too!

title: Horrific GP surgery
body: I've tried to book an appointment for the past 3 days, ring at 8am and then wait 30min to then be told that they have no appointments. I ended up in A&E because things took such a bad turn with my mental health due to the severe pain I was experiencing. Again, was told to go back to my GP practice. The receptionists are some of the most rudest individuals I ever had to encounter. Once I had begged for an appointment, the receptionists became curt and very abrupt because they had no choice but to give me an appointment. They're so rude and have no empathy or skills to talk appropriately to service users. They never have any GPs in, instead they have advanced practitioners who cannot give sicknotes nor can they do referrals which means having to go in twice therefore wasting time and money. This company is owned by an American company so it's only obvious why they are rated so bad. They have also appeared on Yorkshire Evening Post as one of the worst GP surgeries. I have also put in a review and they sent me a reply saying I had written this in capital letters which is deemed as shouting. Which was a complete lie. I did not write in capital letters at all and will take this further as they are not publishing real reviews of how bad this surgery is. People should know who they are signing up with. Thank you.

title: Absolutely rediculous waiting time.
body: 6 hours to check an xray. Had to take a day off work and from my newborn. I'd rather risk being ill than be treated this poorly again.

author: oscarjy85
title: My Son's brilliant experience
body: We had a super experience with Fife health & social care partnership O. T. input from the beginning phone call re my son's bathing needs to the home visit, compiling report, visiting my son in school and all the follow up phone calls keeping me fully advised as to progress.

title: REVIEW OF COLONOSCOPY
body: Very clean and attractive surroundings. Very helpful staff. One disappointing aspect was the fact that I was told by the Doctor that he would speak to me after the procedure to advise me of the results. However, when I asked to speak to him, he had already left for the day. I found this to be totally unsatisfactory.

title: Compassionate Humane Intelligent Discerning
body: Having now had the opportunity to see every doctor at the practice, I have again a sense of what a remarkably consistent service it offers. I am very grateful and appreciate also the way when I needed I was able to get a same day appointment. I am also grateful for the thoughtful advice offered me by a nurse at another recent appointment prompted by the surgery which encouraged me to approach an ongoing health issue in a constructive way.

author: indianscot
title: Food in the canteen
body: I found the food hairmyres canteen over priced & bland, don't try to tell me your prices are fair. Either reduce the prices or increase the portions to match your prices.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Professional service
body:
I was  seen on time for my ultrasound made to feel at ease
 it was a very professional service that I received thank you

author: iamjohndoe
title: All staff went above & beyond
body: I was admitted to ward 24 after bad test results in order to find a diagnosis. All the staff were brilliant and went above and beyond. The nurses & healthcare assistants in particular were extremely kind and wanted to do as much as they could to make you feel better. The doctors were very reassuring and thorough as well.

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care and attention
body: I had laser eye surgery on both eyes yesterday and wanted to express my grateful thanks to my surgeon and his team for the fine care and attention throughout my half day at the hospital. All of those involved were focused on providing as good an experience as possible and I felt very secure and cared for throughout.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Review with pharmacist
body: I’m very happy with the pharmacist, my diabetes has improved with pharmacist advice, diabetes is much better, I am feeling good

author: Mamo
title: My Cystoscopy's
body:
I have a Cystoscopy every 6 months I cannot praise the Consultant,nurses highly enough they are always thoroughly kind,gentle and patient. I hope the unit never closes.  
Thank you to all the staff.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Professional Service
body: We had a new Resident arrive at our Residential Care Home last week and we registered them with Grey Gable Surgery in Inkberrow, Worcestershire. We requested a GP visit which they responded to within a short period of time after making the phone call. Following this visit, all new prescribed medication was available instantly and the professional support that the Resident and the Home received were second to none. We have since had further support and follow up GP visits therefore enabling the Resident to receive the best medical intervention from ourselves. We look forward to a long continued relationship with the Surgery and thank them for their support during this transition.

title: Amazing service
body: I saw the doctor late January with concerns about my legs and feet. She took my concerns seriously and made sure I was given the correct and best care. She went above and beyond to ensure that I was seen promptly and by the correct agencies. She was professional and caring and I can’t thank her enough for my care and recovery.

title: Lack of empathy
body:
My sister is a stage 4 lung cancer patient who has been on chemotherapy for a full year. During this period of time she has had to go to the Blackurn Royal hospital for various appointments.  Frequently there are excessive waiting times despite having a fixed appointment.  People don't seem to realise that they are dealing with extremely ill patients who are quite often experiencing severe pain.  There doesn't seem to be any compassion or concern at all. The effects of the chemotherapy are terrible.  My sister has had numerous painful infections and yet the requests for additional medication to ease pain and prevent further escalation is again another point for serious concern. My sister tells me that she feels like she is always having to beg for assistance.  Again I feel the need to emphasise that she is  extremely ill and needs to feel understood and cared for. She now has painful looking infections on both feet, making it difficult to wear shoes. She was told that she needs Betadine and yet for some inexplicable reason she is not receiving this medication.  Again another example of being ignored.  
Someone needs to take responsibility for the care of patients who are officially registered at this hospital in Blackburn. I fail to understand why this can be blamed on cut backs.  I always believed that doctors and nurses entered their respective professions because of their genuine desire to care for people.  I guess I must be more naive than I thought. 
Something needs to drastically change in improving the quality of life of seriously ill cancer patients.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: minus 5 stars
body:
20 mins on the phone from 0855,  all appointments gone , no calls available and no emergency or triage back up.
no recommendations made.
no care shown, no regard and no responsibility. no hope?

title: Ultrasound Department
body: Thanks to the staff in this dept for their friendly/caring attitude and to the Dr for the FNA carried out yesterday which was pretty much painless.

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Nottingham1862
title: Chemotherapy cancelled
body:
Father in law had chemotherapy cancelled last minute so trying to contact Radiotherapy to see if treatment is still available. Nobody answering phone within 15 - 20 minutes when finally got through nobody available to answer his question. Still none the wiser if treatment is going ahead.  
So frustrating

title: Excellent Practice
body: Visited the GP this morning,the GP was extremely helpful and very thorough. I have been using this Practice for several years and always found the GP's I have seen to be very professional and knowledgeable. Excellent Service.

title: Really frustrating
body: Once you manage to get an appointment things are fine it's just getting an appointment I have been trying now or a week and told no appointments ring again tomorrow then told no appointments till end of march WHY this is disgusting I tried one morning 57 times before I got through but no appointments how do people get these appointments ?wish someone could tell

author: UHW30
title: Happy with care provided
body: Ward 7. Came in via A&E, emergency care unit then admitted To ward. Referred by GP and given letter - waited a wee while before being moved to ward however during that time lots of tests and xrays were carried out. Felt that care provided was excellent. Very attentive. Seen consultants regularly and had scans performed and also biopsy. Saw doctor this morning and onward care plan being finalised. Will return to outpatient clinic. Food is also very good - happy with choices. If using call buzzer staff responded relatively quickly.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

title: Great Healthcare assistant/nurse
body: I was very poorly and at the time didn't know what the main problem was. I went in the surgery for a blood test where I felt so ill that I got upset in front of the healthcare assistant/nurse She was very caring and took the time to listen when she was obviously very busy.  She got me an appointment to see a Doctor the next day.  As I was leaving she even gave me a cuddle.  She made such a difference and I just wanted to say thank you very much to her.  I saw her on the 19th Feb and she was just as nice and caring as she was back then.

title: Weird doctor
body:
Walked into A&E with severe abdomen and kidney pain. After waiting for 3 hours when my number came doctor told me it seems fine but I tried to explain the pain is for past 3 weeks and already seen by GP, given antibiotics and booked an ultra sound scan which is next month.

Rest of the conversation was like
Me - may be it's hernia
Doctor- speak to your GP

Me - may be bowel something...
Doctor - speak to your GP

Me - may be stones
Doctor - as I said speak to your GP

Me- what about the pain
Doctor - take some paracetamol

author: KimG
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Very nice people
body:
I was referred to Hospital at Home by my GP, The staff came out very quickly after that and are very nice people. I was very happy with the attention Amanda gave me, also the doctor was excellent.  
Many Thanks.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Absolutely horrific administration
body: I had been a patient at Parkhouse Medical Centre for over 20 years - and was an extremely happy with this practice, both my partner and I and our 2 children were well cared for. Since the merger of 3 practices into 1 at Lonsdale Medical Centre it has been almost impossible to get hold of the practice: e.g. 30 minutes on hold; 29th in the queue, 17th in the queue.  I thought this might perhaps be teething problems - but it is still persisting, as I found out yesterday.

title: So far I can only rate Trelike Dental at a Zero
body: My daughter who is a teacher went to her regular dentist several times with toothache last year.  She eventually had Xrays there and was told she has severley impacted wisdom teeth and would need surgery to stop the pain.  Surviving on paracetamol for ages, she got an appointment for 6th of Feb and on arrival was told the consultant was off?  Would have thought a TXT would of been nice to say that before driving to the park and ride, but what was more annoying was they could not give her another date to see the consultant.  They said that they would contact her and tell her shortly.  No apology letter, no new appointment date.  She rang consultant secretary to be told they didnt know?   Long story short, pain getting worse daily, paracetemol no longer helping and she is in 9 out of 10 pain and after rining 111 etc as was after hours she ends up having to go to A&E.  They gave prescription meds which help, but still is continually getting worse and they said she need surgery to remove them asap.  She went back to consultant secretary again who said they still have no rescheduled date, will let her know by end of Feb?  She explained been back to dentist, A&E and needs help sooner than later, but told she will have to wait till end of Feb for another date to see consultant? Back to dentist as pain getting worse and swelling, dentist prescribes anti biotics, says to chase consultant secretary, explain that she is in agony and needs urgent care.  Secretary says that still cant give a date, so it goes on.  Last night she came in from work and she couldnt speak she was in excrutiating pain, tried ice pack, hot water bottle etc, in end she had no choice to go back to A&E and get more prescribed pain killers!  So far its cost her more, the Hospital more and this will continue till these impacted wisdom teeth are surgically removed.  Maybe might be good to use the TXT appointment system to let patients know when appointments are cancelled too.  Any way in the meantime my daughter has to endure excrutiating pain, take heavy pain meds and there seems to be no other solution.  She and her partner have even seriously thought about taking her teeth out at home, as she really is at the end of her tether.  Hope it does not come to that.

title: Very friendly practice
body: I have visited this practice many times over the last 50 years and have always found the staff friendly and helpful.

title: Woeful
body: This practice fails to communicate adequately with its patients. Internal systems to prices repeat prescriptions are not fit-for-purpose.

title: Fabulus practice
body: Been registerd at this surgery for 5 years, excallant doctors and reception staff.  Very helpful and always give appointment quickly.  thank you.  I would recommend this surgery.

title: PALS
body: All the replies from Pembury for people that have got problems is contact Pals this is a joke as they never answer there phone they must be so busy with all the complaints they receive from patients they should be caring for

title: Superb standard of care
body: In the eighteen months since registering with this practice, I've been hugely impressed with the standard and of qulity of care provided. From the unexpected but delightful welcome telephone call from the Senior Partner, to the responsiveness  and attentiveness of GPs, nurses and admin staff, Cookham Medical Centre presents a shining example of a truly patient centred NHS Surgery. Easy to get an appointment, friendly, listening doctors (who actually phone back to make sure that all is well after a consultation) and attentive support staff, I cannot speak too highly of all involved. This is by far the best practice I have ever known. Thank you!

title: Quick, efficient and caring
body:
This morning I had an excellent experience at the Urgent Care Centre. The receptionist who checked me in was friendly, warm and efficient. Another receptionist then came over to see me to ask if I needed painkillers and was very kind. I was called quickly in to see the clinic nurse who was wonderful. She took the time for me to tell the whole story of what had happened, she examined me and gave me advice on my next steps. I felt assured and she was very knowledgeable as well as being kind and caring. 
The waiting room was calm, clean and a good temperature. Overall I am so grateful for this service and the lovely people who work there. Thank you

title: Unsatisfactory patient
body: The 4 consultant stated there is nothing more i can do.I had a heart problem.As a doctor they cant find a better cure of my heart problem.

title: Excellent practice
body: Doctor was very sympathetic to my problems and I felt at ease even though my said problem was somewhat personal. All tests were done on a good timely basis to investigate any underlying further problems

title: Very helpful reception staff
body: I recently had contact with the surgery regarding my 97 year old father. On both occasions the reception staff were extremely helpful and went the extra mile to help sort things out.

title: 111 a waste of time
body: Called at 5.30pm and after answering all the questions told I would get a call back, which I did at 11pm, 11.20pm and 12pm, unfortunately I was asleep so missed them, they left a voicemail on each call and on the third call said they've tried three times and would cancel the call, i don't think it's unreasonable to expect me to be asleep and I would've expected them to call in the morning if they couldn't get hold of me rather than cancelling the call.

title: Great practice
body: Lovely caring doctor my health is in great hands very reassuring since starting with epilepsy and having problems getting seizures under control reducing tablets to start new ones dr rang me to reassure i was taking the right dose every week rang me to say i needed my flu vaccination and blood tests were due to be done said he was looking through my notes and gave me a ring for an update on my epilepsy and oncoming hospital neurology appointments

title: Efficient and caring
body:
Unfortunately I had to arrive at the hospital in an ambulance and the paramedics were so kind and helped to make me calmer and comfortable.  They deserve to be recognised for their compassion and hard work.  I was attended to in the hospital immediately and although it was scary to start with, the kindness of all staff helped it to be more comfortable.  When I was told I would be staying and moved to a ward, it was all handled promptly.  My main thoughts during my stay are that they work long hours and it is constant.  They make you feel as if you are the only person to care for and enjoy their work without showing signs of stress.  I hear so many bad comments about the hospital, but for me, although I was unwell and didn’t want to be there, I can’t fault the care that I received. 
Is there a way of the paramedics that helped, being told they were excellent ? because I’m sure they get many negative complaints and they deserve praise in my opinion.

title: Don't answer phones and can't get appointment!!
body:
Called at 8am numerous times , finally got put on hold 8th in the que (not too bad) finally got down to 3rd in the que and ended up on hold for 38 minuites !! I ended up going to the surgery whilst still on hold to find no telephones were ringing and the 3 receptionists were sat on computers . When i finally spoke to someone she had a very poor attitude towards me , no apology or even hello ! People come to the surgery because they are sick they shouldn't be made to feel uncomfortable because they need to see a doctor. Its very poor service i will have to have a long hard think whether this surgery is for my family any more . A smile goes a long way ?! Also the glass is not sound proof in the receptionists room either ( just a head up !!!!) 

I must admit soon as you move from reception to actually be seen you are treated with dignity and respect.

title: professional, efficient and friendly.
body: Third check over last few years---excellent service from Professional staff.  make you feel welcome. All staff efficient and friendly.

title: no online appointments
body: Tried to make on the day appointment to see a doctor, got up at 6am to book the online appointment, but no appointments were available, got to the surgery at 7:40 and there was a queue of people to make appointments, who also couldn't book online, then had to wait till 9:30 to see someone, two hours in the surgery, not happy at all, this is not good

title: Great Caring and understing
body: I was suffering from right Thai pain and not able to stand on my leg or walk, but as per treatment of This GB specially one particular doctor have diagnosed my problem and started my treatment which help me a lot. He had also advised me about physiotherapy and keep the exercise continue. My daily routine (like going to the office ) was impacted and last 10 days. But now seems I will start my office soon. This doctor heard my problem very carefully with presence and prescribe the medicine accordingly. I am still under recovery. Though, hoping in a few weeks I would get well 100%. But this doctor help me to recover my intolerable pain like god. I will also give thanks to this GP staff who had direct and given me the appointment when it was available in same day as well.

title: Great service
body: I am very happy for my first visiting in this G.P. service is very friendly and fast. The staff is great and kind!

author: norrahs66
title: Long wait time for referral
body: Waited 4 months for the appointment, needed an MRI, waited 6 weeks, now coming up 10 weeks and still no MRI report or plan of action for my care. After requesting another referral to a different hospital I was referred to Yeovil. The referral letter from my GP to Yeovil I found offensive, therefore I have since declined the referral.

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely terrible
body: Haven’t gotten back to me for months. No point in using the service they are terrible. Had a 45 minute chat and they disappeared for a month before returning a month ago and now disappeared again. Thanks nhs for the minimal effort put into helping people’s mental health. Please improve talking space because mental health is fragile and crucial

author: UHW31
title: Week stay
body:
Ward 11.  
Staff have been quite good.  
Communication with doctor not very clear.  
Today for example doctor came but because patient had visitor at that time so no update given.  
Patient thought they would maybe get out today. Advised to speak to nurse for update.  
Speech and language therapist put patient on a puréed diet which is not to their liking although the patient understands why this is required.  
Staff kind and look after patient to the best of their availability. Seen physiotherapist and occupational therapist.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: L-A9295
title: Venesection Clinic
body: I attend the venesection clinic at Forth Valley Royal hospital. I have a dedicated nurse, Cath, who is lovely and makes me feel very comfortable and at ease. My appointments are made to work around my work shifts and the clinic always runs to time so I never feel stressed or anxious.   Cath is happy to discuss all elements of my care and makes sure I'm happy with everything that's being done.

readBy.name: Office of Angus MacDonald, MSP for Falkirk East

author: UHW32
title: Inpatient stay since november
body:
Ward 16. Staff brilliant. Patient been in and out 3 or 4 times.  
Is allowed out on weekend pass - had various procedures and is hopefully getting out tomorrow.  
Food is not great. Salad is ok but hot meals not so good.  
Patient finds it difficult to sleep due to other patients being noisy. Communication with doctor very good. Understands future care plan.  
Couple of minutes to wait when call buzzer used.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: mcard95
title: Cant get through on the phone
body:
I have been trying the number for the incontinence service from a letter I received however I cannot get through, I have phoned 5 times now and left my contact details and no-one has returned my call. It states on the letter that if I do not make another appointment within 1 week on the date of this letter I will no longer be able to access the service which is very worrying.  
Please can someone advise me what to do?

author: DCH
title: Great one stop shop
body:
Having attended the Breast Unit today following discovery of a breast lump, I would like to thank all staff for their friendly, caring and professional service. After examination and screening, I was very lucky to be reassured that everything was normal.  
A great ‘One Stop Shop’ and wonderful service. Thank you again.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: Mac Alister
title: Stress therapy
body:
I had work related stress and my GP referred me to Inclusion for counseling. I went to one to one sessions each week to talk about my problems and learn strategies for dealing with my worries.  
At first I found it difficult to talk about how I felt but with the therapist help I was able to see that I could manage my worries one day at a time.

author: CEF83
title: Ante natal USS
body: Had 20 week obstetric USS & midwife/sonographer who performed the   scan was amazing....very gentle, calm, methodical & thorough....couldn’t fault her care & attention & cant thank her enough for putting our minds at ease today. Even when there were some placental concerns, it was explained in a calm & stress free way & a follow up plan made. Extremely positive experience today made possible by a very professional & professional member of staff....thank you....

author: NTM
title: Great facility for non urgent cases
body: Went to A and E with damaged finger but felt a bit uncomfortable. Pleased to be referred to Minor Injuries Unit where I was seen, had an x-ray, had wound cleaned and dressed in less than an hour. This is a great facility which takes non urgent cases out of A and E. Good all round.

author: 123 Jeff
title: Thanks for Excellent care.
body: Just like to thank Mr Giurea and his staff working in the Orthopaedic department at Royal Cornwall Hospital's for there help and care given.

author: debo123
title: 5 star Knee repair operation consultation
body: I was seen by Mr Keenan orthopaedic surgeon today. I was very happy with the service I received, the care and attention was 5 stars, I would be very happy for Mr Keenan to do my operation on my knee as we discussed, there would be no hesitation.

title: Dysfunctional
body:
I asked for a blood test to check my cholesterol and was advised by a GP that due to too many patients requesting blood tests which the practice deemed unnecessary, that blood will not be taken any more at the patients' request.

So I ask where does that leave me when I need a HbA1c for a diabetic clinic appointment? The GP asked me to ask my consultant to send them a letter requesting a blood test. When I informed my consultant, he said they should be testing my blood anyway, meaning that it should not take a letter from him to Ashton Medical Group to check my cholesterol and HbA1c etc etc.

I will turn up to my next consultant appointment at the diabetic clinic for the 2nd time without having had a HbA1c and see what happens. This blanket ban will suit some patients but not all because the prevention is better than cure does not apply at AMG.

Appointments to see GPs are not possible anymore unless we ring at 08:00 in the morning, if I ring too late, no matter what the urgency I have to call back the following morning.

author: North East service user
title: Very grateful for Emergency surgery
body:
Five weeks ago I went to a muscular skeletal appointment and north tyneside general hospital during my consultation with the consultant I was then sent for a emergency mri on my spine at Cramlington emergency care hospital.  
Upon results later the same day I was then sent via ambulance to the R. V. I hospital where I was seen by a spinal surgeon. Early the following morning I was in theatre for a emergency op on my spine. If I hadn't had the op I would have ended up paralysed from the waist down. This was very worrying at the time.  
With the expertise of all the staff I seen during this time and a top spinal surgeon I am now five weeks post op and doing really well. The staff at all hospitals and ward 15 at the R. V. I plus the surgeon and registrar were outstanding in their care and knowledge.  
Very grateful to the NHS and its staff.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great caring ward
body: I had to have an angiogram and the staff in the cardiac catheter unit made the whole experience less frightening. Not a very pleasant procedure but made a lot more bearable by the kind and caring staff. So a huge thankyou from a very grateful patient. Also a lovely outcome to be told my heart is fine if not perfectly formed. But honestly from the reception desk to the nursing staff and specialists who carried out the procedure I was put at my ease. So again thankyou.

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Understanding
body: The doctor great as ever - knew me, understood my needs and situation and acted exactly as would have hoped. A great experience as ever

title: really good practicing nurse
body: i spoke to the nurse today as this was my first visit to the practice  really easy to talk to so professional she did an awesome job of just listening and explaining things where some other practice  nurses not here but other places that ive seen before where rude  in polite and i found didn't help at if she is anything to go by i think i will like this new gp practice shes  a lovely person

title: No soap in the ladies
body: Accompanied my husband to stroke unit. Very confusing instructions about where to go. No one to look after my husband when I had to go and move the car. No soap in the ladies toilet so could not wash hands.

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Keep up the good work
body:
I like this service, the staff are very friendly and feel genuine care from them. Well done guys!  
Keep up the good work.

title: Great Practice
body: I was treated in April 2019 and my wife was recently treated in January this year. On both occasions the staff were excellent, this includes reception and all the medical staff. Everyone was friendly,helpful and sympathetic to our problems. Nothing was too much trouble even though they were extremely busy. The staff are to be commended for the way they dealt with people. As far as we are concerned everything was good about our visit. We continually tell everyone how well we were looked after.

title: Very disappointed
body: After being with this practice for round 20 years, I have recently had a very negative experience. Although the care I have received from doctors remains good, there seems to be no sense of care or empathy in the current administrative staff. The difficulty I am experiencing in getting appointments, getting prescriptions or just being communicated with is all causing me considerable distress. I am intending to change practice as son as possible, since I feel these issues are now having a negative impact on my health.

title: Amazing practice
body: Everything about my experience was comfortable and reassuring. I was extremely nervous due to traumatic experiences involving scans in the past but my practitioner made sure I was comfortable and at ease, was extremely accommodating and the scan itself was quick and painless. The facilities are modern and clean, my appointment was on time, my practitioners disposition was lovely and I couldn’t be happier with my experience, especially as I was so nervous.

title: Great practice
body: Last week I had an appointment with the doctor.  He is an outstanding GP who listened attentively, spoke clearly and explained his thinking behind the tests  which he required to make a diagnosis.  I left feeling very reassured and impressed at the truly exceptional service.   The outstanding service continued that day when he called me at 8pm! to reassure me that my blood tests were normal.  I was blown away by his professionalism and dedication to his patients.  How very lucky we are to have such  amazing GP's working for the NHS.

title: Very happy
body: Everything was prompt and courteous. Very efficient. Everyone was very helpful. Totally painless and the outcome is brilliant. All natural colours in my eye restored.

title: First class service.
body:
I have attended the Romford facility 3 times recently, and in each instance I received excellent service, I was treated in a caring and respectful manner, everything explained clearly, all questions answered easily for me to understand. 
  First class service, first class facility.

title: The doctor is great
body: I’m a new patient & visited the doctor requesting a private letter, there was so confusion & I collected my letter which had all the details I required. Many thanks to the doctor.

title: Very efficient practice
body: The doctor very good straight forward no bull best doctor ever seen on time clear concise and understandable.reception desk ladies very plesent try there hardest to fit you in allways with a smile no matter what  clients they had previose

title: why can't I take prescriptions issued to my own…
body: Sorry i have tried to find a better way than a review page to air my complaint but trying to register a complaint regarding pharmacy practice and medication is proving impossible. I want to know why we can't take prescriptions to our own local chemist if they are issued at Broomfield hospital? Today's wait was already 1hr 30 mins and is bound to be increasing because patients are unable to take prescriptions to their own local chemist. when I had the same issue in December 2019 I had to wait 3 hours for a prescription to be dispensed. Surely allowing patience to take prescriptions issued at broomfield hospital to their own pharmacy would reduce these excessive wait times and also improve wait times for medication for patients waiting to be discharged from your hospitals and mean beds are available quicker. this also has a impact on parking at the hospital as the longer patients are sat waiting for prescriptions unnecessarily the longer their cars are blocking the car park.  I am sure the staff at the front desk of the pharmacy are fed up of hearing patients complain about this. Why can't this be looked into? Please note this review in no way reflects the staff at the Pharmacy who are always helpful and polite and who do a thankless job. They deserve not to have patients like me moan at them about things like this, their time can be used in better ways!

title: Very good experience
body: I had difficulty getting through to the surgery on the phone, so made this appointment on line.  For some reason the information was not up to date, so after making an appointment for the next day, this proved to be a mistake and I had to wait for a couple weeks, but figured that was ok. On entering the room,the GP apologised for me having to wait (10 minutes, which feels very little these days!), was friendly and relaxed.  She made me feel less embarrassed about the reason I was there and was kind and informative, and ensured I understood her advice by repeating it a couple times.  This is the first time I have seen this GP and only the second time I have been to this surgery.  I would be happy to see her again.

author: Shieva
title: Lack of communication and slow treatment
body:
Referred to urology as requested and asked for mp MRI to diagnose possible prostate cancer. Had what I now assume was a normal MRI without contrast (told it was not necessary) weeks passed and no result.  
Phoned to find out what was happening and out of the blue I received an appointment for a trus biopsy, no discussion about results. Biopsy came back negative, but PSA kept rising.  
Further MRI with contrast was done and was told by phone call that it had shown something that was difficult to biopsy and would require template biopsy. This time cancer was diagnosed and further bone scan etc were ordered. As quite a time had passed I decided to seek a private consultation and was admitted for radical surgery within two weeks, I had yet to attend all of the NHS consultants, but time was now a consideration.  
While all staff were great, they were also very upbeat, masking the urgency that has turned out to be obvious. I now know that the original MRI noted the likelihood of cancer, yet without my contact nothing was done, the second MRI report stated "urgent" yet more than six months had passed since the scan and I had still to see any surgeon or oncologist. Hence the private consult.  
In total this process had taken almost two years and now my psi is once again detectable. I have been very let down by the system.

readBy.name: Office of Ken Macintosh, MSP for West of Scotland
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Great Practice , caring staff
body:
Attended for a persistent problem today , seen by the trainee GP . A great service with really good customer focus
 Answered questions , sought additional advice and generally offered a lot of reassurance . You get a sense nothing is too much trouble and there is real care for patients and getting a good outcome for them. There is a strong sense of team work , this is a fantastic practice .

title: Fantastic service
body: I am really happy with all of the doctors at this practice, the reception staff are brilliant and always willing to help and when I have needed other assistance they always make me feel like nothing is too much trouble
